attributes.action: Introduce Proportional Representation for all UK Elections
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Under the current "First Past the Post" election system the views of a large number of people do not get represented. General Elections have been won with less than 1/3 of the votes.

In European Elections there is a system called Proportional Representation. This system allows the parties to create a list of the people who they would like to be elected. Once the results are in the number of seats won by each party is based on the percentage of the vote. So, if a party has 5% of the vote they will get 5% of the seats in that election.

This system would give a voice to the smaller parties and would enable supporters of those parties to be represented.

rejection.details:
There is already a similar petition here:
http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/CPR2006/
If you still wish your own to be launched, please resubmit.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
